alert.note: Alert for Eastern Mogollon Rim; Little Colorado River Valley in Apache County; Little Colorado River Valley in Navajo County (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 11:21AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm cluster will impact portions of Apache and Navajo Counties near Snowflake, Taylor and Shumway through 1145 AM MST... At 1119 AM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles northeast of Taylor, or 21 miles north of Show Low, moving northwest at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds of 40 to 45 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Taylor, Woodruff, Shumway, Snowflake and Dry Lake. This includes the following highways... State Route 277 between mile markers 329 and 336. State Route 377 between mile markers 13 and 21. State Route 77 between mile markers 350 and 381. Highway 180 between mile markers 316 and 318. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes. Strong outflow winds may not be accompanied by heavy rainfall. If out recreating on smaller waterways, head to shore!

area.areaDesc: Eastern Mogollon Rim; Little Colorado River Valley in Apache County; Little Colorado River Valley in Navajo County
